lexUnit.name: comprehensible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: able to be understood; intelligible

sentence.text: " Force " is an ordinary English word , apparently chosen because it is comprehensible to lay people .

The idea that the Renaissance could be named , classified , described , and interpreted so that it was rendered readily comprehensible within some generalised scheme of the humanities was no longer a clearly defined process .
The English that has developed in the country -- certainly its spoken version -- will not be readily comprehensible to those from outside the sub-continent .
The presentation is crisp and the topics broken down into easily comprehensible parts : every page tells a story and does it in such a delightful way that the reader is led on through the book .
More easily comprehensible is the enormous success Wilcox enjoyed in the following year with Rookery Nook ( 1930 ) , the first of the Ben Travers farces he brought to the screen .
All of your other utterances were readily comprehensible . "
The simplest and most readily comprehensible model of government hardly exists .

Analysis of early fourteenth-century letter-collections would show that a form of French , perfectly comprehensible to both Frenchmen and Englishmen alike , was the normal language of secular correspondence .
What was more , I could understand what the men were saying ; although their accents were strange , their French was perfectly comprehensible .

By uncovering the contribution made by ` serious " religion to the wider Ulster society by c1900 this study will make more comprehensible many neglected aspects of life and custom in the twentieth-century Ulster .
The present system is no more comprehensible to the public in this respect than was its predecessor .
Linstead Market celebrates the very place where White was born , and brings a delightful lyric about buying and selling that is only half comprehensible to a non-West-Indian ear .

Beethoven is the historical fulcrum ; in his work the two aspects are perfectly balanced , and the uniqueness of the individual musical idea is organically integrated into a socially comprehensible but freely worked-out totality .
The popularity of Wade 's sculpture was probably due not only to the fact that it was always comprehensible but that it was both ennobling and restrained in equal measure .
It had been passed from hand to hand along a chain of trusted men until it came into his own , its message comprehensible only to his eyes .

It is Scottish Opera policy to present their operas in English , and while this can make lengthy recitatives comprehensible to those of us whose Italian is less than fluent , I can see no other advantage .
Land warfare sixty-five years after Waterloo would still have been comprehensible to Napoleon .
But the main features of the system must be comprehensible to those Members of Parliament and councillors who are not specialists and to serious commentators and interested members of the public .
Its goal would be to describe ( at least in part ) the subjective character of experiences in a form comprehensible to beings incapable of having those particular experiences .

The new edition , largely rewritten , aims ` to combine a complete and scientifically acceptable coverage of the field with sufficient elementary explanation to make this comprehensible by readers without a scientific training " .
We should see if there is a horizon between what is , and what is not comprehensible by us .
The fact that both Jesus and Peter upset their critics by eating with Gentiles is comprehensible in terms of the violation of Jewish law .
The research aims to produce a comprehensible assessment of the economic effects of different institutional structures , at both macro and micro levels .

Drama is easier to convey than analysis , rather as the political decisions of kings and queens make for more comprehensible history in the schoolroom than do gradual shifts in economic and social patterns .

( The first text is in fact comprehensible , but processing it is a much slower and more laborious affair . )
These lectures making science comprehensible and palatable for the fashionable , the earnest and the intellectual circles of London were not the whole programme of the Institution .
The Korean language was comprehensible throughout the country with major differences only in Cheju island .
